com.meteorcode.pathway.samples.sparks

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.model.GameObject
      • com.meteorcode.pathway.samples.sparks.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends GameObject
    This is a simple ball class, implementing a very primitive sphere shape.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.meteorcode.pathway.model.GameObject

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(int width,
    int height)
        Construct a random ball inside the given width/height rectangle of space. The method ensures that the ball will be inside the given rectangle of space, and all of the other ball parameters are generated randomly, such as velocity and radius.
        Parameters:
        width - The maximum width of the area that the ball may be inside. Note that width must be > 0
        height - The maximum height of the area that the ball may be inside. Note that the height must > than 0

      • Ball

        public Ball(int x,
    int y,
    int radius,
    float vx,
    float vy)
        Construct a ball with the given parameters exactly.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the ball
        y - The Y position of the ball
        radius - The radius of the ball.
        vx - The velocity of the ball in the X direction
        vy - The velocity of the ball in the Y direction

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the X position of the ball as an integer.
        Returns:
        The X position of the ball

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the Y position of the ball as an integer
        Returns:
        The Y position of the ball

      • getRadius

        public int getRadius()
        Returns the radius of the ball, as an integer
        Returns:
        The radius of the ball

      • bounce

        public void bounce()
        Bounces the ball in both the X and the Y directions by reversing the ball's velocity.

      • go

        public void go()
        Steps the ball one step into the future, by adding the ball's velocity to its existing X and Y positions.

      • gradient

        public float gradient(float x,
             float y)
        Returns a gradient percentage of how far the given point is from the center of the ball. If outside the ball, this percentage is 0, otherwise the percentage is the fraction representing the distance the given point is between the center of the ball and its radius.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the point to test
        y - The Y coordinate of the point to test
        Returns:
        The percent gradient of this ball at the tested point, as a float whose value is between 0 and 1

      • distance

        public float distance(float x,
             float y)
        Returns the absolute distance between a given point and the center of this ball.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the point to test
        y - The Y coordinate of the point to test
        Returns:
        The distance between the tested point and the center of this ball.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Ball other)
        Tests whether or not two balls intersect with one another.
        Parameters:
        other - The other ball to test with.
        Returns:
        True if this ball and the tested ball intersect, false otherwise.

      • oob

        public boolean oob(int maxWidth,
          int maxHeight)
        Checks whether a ball would be out of bounds of the given rectangular space.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - The width of the rectangular space to test
        maxHeight - The height of the rectangular space to test
        Returns:
        True if the ball would fall outside the given rectangle, false otherwise.
